overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto has a significant social media presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to disinformation, computational social science, and information operations. Engagement varies across platforms, with LinkedIn showing the highest average engagement per post due to its professional audience. The content is heavily focused on announcing research findings, job opportunities, and conference participation.

contentThemes.description: Sharing updates on research publications, grants, and findings related to social media analysis and information operations.
Advertising postdoctoral and PhD positions in computational social science and related fields.
Promoting presentations and involvement in conferences focused on disinformation and related topics.
Announcing the release of software tools for detecting coordinated behavior.

recommendations: Diversify content formats (e.g., include visuals like images and videos) to increase engagement.
Engage more actively with followers by asking questions and responding to comments.
Tailor content to each platform's audience and optimal posting times.
Use relevant hashtags to expand reach beyond the existing follower base.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows good engagement with research publications and research opportunities for PhD students. Leveraging this platform for discussions and Q&A sessions could enhance interaction.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon content is more focused on methodological discussions and tool releases. Consider posting more frequently with focused content to engage the academic community.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is highly effective for announcing grants and job opportunities. Continue to focus on professional announcements and networking within this platform.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
